item.title: By: Darrell Malick
item.dc:creator: Darrell Malick
item.description: Seems quite likely! Look forward to it.
item.content:encoded: Seems quite likely! Look forward to it.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You're welcome! And for future events, I'll do my best to take better notes so that I can provide an even better account next time!
item.content:encoded: You’re welcome! And for future events, I’ll do my best to take better notes so that I can provide an even better account next time!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's my next goal: to attend a Go Congress in Europe! Haha. Perhaps I will have the opportunity to meet you there someday!
item.content:encoded: That’s my next goal: to attend a Go Congress in Europe! Haha. Perhaps I will have the opportunity to meet you there someday!

item.title: By: Darrell Malick
item.dc:creator: Darrell Malick
item.description: I love the Go Congresses. This year circumstances sent me to the European Congress in Sibu Romania, and it was really great! But I do miss my Go friends in the US. Thanks for the posts!
item.content:encoded: I love the Go Congresses. This year circumstances sent me to the European Congress in Sibu Romania, and it was really great! But I do miss my Go friends in the US. Thanks for the posts!

item.title: By: Brian Pagano
item.dc:creator: Brian Pagano
item.description: Thanks for posting this series. You gave us a good taste of what it was like to attend.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for posting this series. You gave us a good taste of what it was like to attend.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: True true, but at least that would require some digging. And to be honest, I am probably just concerned with games that are one-sided where it could be embarrassing for my opponent. And since I think it would be a tad odd to ask every opponent if they are okay with me posting the game on my blog with their name on the kifu, I usually just anonymize it unless it's a friend (just to be safe).
item.content:encoded: True true, but at least that would require some digging. And to be honest, I am probably just concerned with games that are one-sided where it could be embarrassing for my opponent. And since I think it would be a tad odd to ask every opponent if they are okay with me posting the game on my blog with their name on the kifu, I usually just anonymize it unless it’s a friend (just to be safe).

item.title: By: Terri Schurter
item.dc:creator: Terri Schurter
item.description: Anyone can look up the pairings if they want. So much for anonymity.
item.content:encoded: Anyone can look up the pairings if they want. So much for anonymity.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Hahaha. I think it's great you ask them for permission. And I think it's great that you almost got every single one of your opponents! For me, my key memorabilia from each match is the kifu. And I don't know if it's just me, but I'm always worried people would rather be anonymous than be identified (since I post all my game records on the blog). Maybe it's just me being crazy though. Haha.
item.content:encoded: Hahaha. I think it’s great you ask them for permission. And I think it’s great that you almost got every single one of your opponents! For me, my key memorabilia from each match is the kifu. And I don’t know if it’s just me, but I’m always worried people would rather be anonymous than be identified (since I post all my game records on the blog). Maybe it’s just me being crazy though. Haha.

item.title: By: Terri Schurter
item.dc:creator: Terri Schurter
item.description: I do ask permission to take their picture before we play. I explain that I am taking pictures of all of my opponents in the US Open. I don't say I will post the pictures on my blog, but maybe I will say that next year, or I'll just do it. I think people like that kind of thing. I forgot to take a picture of the Round 3 opponent, and never did track her down to get one later. I didn't take one of my 5th Round opponent until after the game was over. I had won it, and we went to report the results and then I asked him if he would return to the board for a photograph, which he did. He was really nice so I felt as if I could ask him. I said, "Pretend the game hasn't happened yet". Or something like that. I had a perverse impulse to say, "Pretend you still have a chance to win." because he was a really nice guy, and was taking the loss well, but that would have been way over the top, so I held my tongue.
item.content:encoded:
I do ask permission to take their picture before we play. I explain that I am taking pictures of all of my opponents in the US Open. I don’t say I will post the pictures on my blog, but maybe I will say that next year, or I’ll just do it. I think people like that kind of thing.
I forgot to take a picture of the Round 3 opponent, and never did track her down to get one later. I didn’t take one of my 5th Round opponent until after the game was over. I had won it, and we went to report the results and then I asked him if he would return to the board for a photograph, which he did. He was really nice so I felt as if I could ask him. I said, “Pretend the game hasn’t happened yet”. Or something like that. I had a perverse impulse to say, “Pretend you still have a chance to win.” because he was a really nice guy, and was taking the loss well, but that would have been way over the top, so I held my tongue.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Oh nice! I might have done the same if I had played in the Open, but sometimes I worry that people will be weirded out. Maybe I'll just ask them for permission to post their picture on the blog? Haha.
item.content:encoded: Oh nice! I might have done the same if I had played in the Open, but sometimes I worry that people will be weirded out. Maybe I’ll just ask them for permission to post their picture on the blog? Haha.
